title: Paul Klee Notebooks v1 - The Thinking Eye (Art Ebook).pdf
description:
Paul Klee Notebooks vol.1: The Thinking Eye
Lund Humphries | 1969 | ISBN: 0853310858 | English | 598 pages | PDF | 41.4 MB

Paul Klee Notebooks is a two-volume work by Paul Klee that collects his lectures at the Bauhaus schools in 1920s Germany and his other main essays on modern art. These works are considered so important for understanding modern art that they are compared to the importance that Leonardoâ€™s A Treatise on Painting had for Renaissance; Herbert Read called the collection â€œthe most complete presentation of the principles of design ever made by a modern artist â€“ it constitutes the Principia Aesthetica of a new era of art, in which Klee occupies a position comparable to Newtonâ€™s in the realm of physics
